conclusion: Analyze equilibrium forces acting on the charged particle to find electric field strength.
The image shows a small ball with mass m and charge q suspended by a string at angle θ.
Identify forces: gravitational force (mg), electric force (qE), tension (T).
Gravitational force direction is vertically downward.
Electric force direction is horizontally to the right.
Tension direction is along the string.
Resolve forces into components; net force must be zero in equilibrium.
Vertical component of tension balances gravitational force: T cos θ = mg.
Horizontal component of tension balances electric force: T sin θ = qE.
Solve for tension T: T = mg / cos θ.
Substitute T into horizontal equation: (mg / cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify to mg tan θ = qE.
Solve for electric field strength E: E = mg tan θ / q.
Final answer: Electric field strength is mg tan θ / q.
